stories.text:
I've seen this just a few times and I thought it was cool to see a cost breakdown of some item or service. It could be broken down in various levels of detail, aggregated by materials, labor, and overhead, or down to individual component costs.

Have you seen this practice? Is there a name for it? Are there good reasons why this not a good idea?
stories.title: Ask HN: How common is publishing line item costs with a product?

stories.text: I'm learning to code and my laptop broke (again), this time for good I think. I can't really buy one right now, so this will delay my learning a lot. Anything that can run Fedora and a web browser is good enough. e-mail in bio if you can help, thanks.
stories.title: Ask HN: Any laptop laying around you're willing to give or sell for cheap?

stories.text:
Why are banks in US not increasing interest rates for checking or savings account for their retail customers when inflation is 8%+ and prime rate 4%+?

Is this pure greed or by govt regulation or something else. Would like to get a banker/financierâ€™s perspective.
stories.title: Ask HN: Why are checking/savings interest rates so low?
